summary:
6. Encourages Chad and Central African Republic governments to cooperate with the UN and EU for a smooth transition.

7. Encourages troop-contributing countries to pledge necessary force requirements.

8. Requests the Secretary-General to submit a report by 15 November 2008 on MINURCAT's deployment and planning for a UN military presence in north-eastern Central African Republic.

9. Requests regular reports on the security and humanitarian situation in eastern Chad, north-eastern Central African Republic, and the region.

10. Intends to adopt a decision on paragraphs 4 and 5 by 15 December 2008.

11. Encourages Sudan, Chad, and Central African Republic to cooperate to implement the Dakar Accord and previous agreements.

12. Demands armed groups cease violence and urges parties to respect and implement the Sirte and Libreville agreements.

13. Encourages national dialogue in Chad and Central African Republic, with respect for constitutional frameworks.

14. Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
